intro: Schwenckia trujilloi, commonly known as the Trujillo's false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its basal rosette of elongated, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is adapted to grow in rocky or arid environments. Schwenckia trujilloi is relatively rare and has limited distribution, making it of interest to botanists and conservationists. Its unique morphology and ecological niche contribute to its significance in the study of Andean flora.
